data.title: What happened to the memorable film themes?
data.meta_description: Some films have themes that just stick with us.
data.text:
Music from films has always been a source of some good tunes. There were once some prolific writers.

As I'm into "film noir," one of the "old time" film score writers I appreciate is Max Steiner. May 10, 1888 â€“ December 28, 1971

He had a gift for writing the right sort of music for every scene,"including incidental music."

His art was writing "big themes" and also music to be played softly, when characters were speaking in normal or hushed tones.

This is a list of the films for which he is credited. There's an awful lot of "classics" in there.

1929 through 1939 Year Film Director Role Production Company Awards Notes Orchestrator

What I have noticed recently, there's a lot of "Action Films," now, with similar what I call "Jason Bourne Music."
